results.title: A Psychopath
results.creator_credit: Henwar Rodakiewicz, Robert Anderson and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description: A study of anti-social personality disorders. Presents the case history of a convicted burglar of high intelligence, a psychopath whose criminal tendencies constitute a threat to his community. Filmed at Verdun Protestant Hospital with Dr H. B. Durost as the interviewing psychiatrist and commentator.

results.title: A Prospect of Kew
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World about us”.
Richard Mabey goes beyond the showpiece attractions of the Kew Gardens in Surrey to reveal how its two centuries of history and its scientific research has made it the international centre for plant conservation.

results.title: A Proper little mother to them all
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
How does the oldest girl in a family look after her brothers and sisters when the mother has died or gone away? This film is about two such cases. Seventeen-year-old Carole who lost her mother through cancer a year ago, now looks after six young brothers and sisters on her own. Frances, who comes from a family of twelve however, has a father who works and provides for the family, and a Home Help who also does a lot of hard work for the twelve children, but Frances is the only mother the younger children will ever know.

results.title: A Promise for tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Michael Maltby and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The one-year crusade of the schooner Norma and Gladys sent by Canada to illustrate to the world that new concepts and ideas are needed if the oceans are to survive the onslaught of man. The boat stopped in New York where the Law of the Sea Conference was debating the issue. As a result of these actions, on June 4, 1976, Canada was able to proclaim her sovereignty over a 200 mile fishing zone.

results.title: A Private War
results.creator_credit: Kamala Films, Thunder Road, Denver and Delilah Productions, Savvy Media Holdings, Michael O'Connor, Arash Amel, Matthew Heineman, Matthew George, Marissa McMahon, Sophie Becher, Charlize Theron and Basil Iwanyk
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2018
results.brief_description: One of the most celebrated war correspondents of our time, Marie Colvin is an utterly fearless and rebellious spirit, driven to the frontlines of conflicts across the globe to give voice to the voiceless.

constellations_other.name: Cities under siege
constellations_other.description: The Syrian Civil War is an ongoing conflict that is arguably the most documented in history, with images and videos captured by journalists, activists, combatants and victims.

results.title: A Private function
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Mowbray, Mark Shivas and HandMade Films
results.brief_description: Driven by the desperate social ambitions of his wife Joyce, (Maggie Smith), one act of folly turned the life of sensitive, small-town chiropodist, Gilbert Chilvers, (Michael Palin), into a nightmare. With Britain in the grip of post-war rationing, Gilbert steals Betty, a contraband pig being secretly fattened by a group of town dignitaries for a banquet to celebrate the Other Royal Wedding. But there is a price to pay. Gilbert’s squeamishness, his mother-in-law’s senility, and Betty’s incontinence lead to trouble and Gilbert ends up with blood on his hands and the police on the doorstep.

results.title: A Prison film: still living
results.brief_description: An open-ended film which examines life inside a women’s prison. The women in the institution are still very much alive and therefore still grappling with the same human concerns as the rest of us - except that incarceration serves to heighten those problems. Individual inmates and staff members of the prison express their attitudes, concerns, doubts and hopes.
